title: Microsoft starts rolling out redesigned Outlook beta app for Windows
content:
Microsoft is rolling out an updated version of the Outlook desktop app for Windows to Office Insiders enrolled in the Beta channel. To be clear, this is an update to Outlook itself and not yet a replacement for the Mail app that’s built into Windows 11. The new app is nearly identical to the version

The post Microsoft starts rolling out redesigned Outlook beta app for Windows appeared first on XDA.
description: Office Insiders in the Beta channel can now try the new Outlook app for Windows, based on the web version. You'll need to be a business user.
